# adaptivePresentationStyle(for:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate for the new presentation style to use.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func adaptivePresentationStyle(for controller: UIPresentationController) -> UIModalPresentationStyle
```

## Parameters

- **controller**: The presentation controller that is managing the size change. Use this object to retrieve the view controllers involved in the presentation.

## Return Value

The new presentation style, which must be [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/fullScreen], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/overFullScreen], or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/none].

## Discussion

In iOS 8.3 and later, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAdaptivePresentationControllerDelegate/adaptivePresentationStyle(for:traitCollection:)] method to handle all trait changes instead of this method. If you do not implement that method, you can use this method to change the presentation style when transitioning to a horizontally compact environment.

If you do not implement this method or if you return an invalid style, the current presentation controller returns its preferred default style.

## Adapting the presentation style

- **adaptivePresentationStyle(for:traitCollection:)**: Asks the delegate for the presentation style to use when the specified set of traits are active.
